name: Weedle
flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Kakuna
flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Kakuna and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Beedrill
flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
Attack1Text: If this Pokémon evolved from Kakuna during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Cacnea
flavorText: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.
Attack1Text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Cacturne
flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.
Attack2Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

name: Karrablast
flavorText: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Shelmet from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Shelmet
flavorText: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Accelgor
flavorText: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.

name: Skiddo
flavorText: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

name: Gogoat
flavorText: It can tell how its trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathetic sense lets them run as if one being.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon's attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Alolan Marowak
flavorText: The bones it possesses were once its mother's. Its mother's regrets have become like a vengeful spirit protecting this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: For each Energy attached to your opponent's Pokémon, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If either of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Numel
flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

name: Camerupt
flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years—or whenever it becomes really angry.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Staryu
flavorText: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.

name: Starmie
flavorText: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you'll soon grow tired of seeing them.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Gyarados-GX
Attack2Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

name: Swinub
flavorText: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

name: Piloswine
flavorText: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 90 damage from it.

name: Mamoswine
flavorText: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: You may put up to 9 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

name: Remoraid
flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

name: Octillery
flavorText: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: You may discard a Special Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Corphish
flavorText: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.

name: Crawdaunt
flavorText: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Feebas
flavorText: A tough Pokémon that is perfectly fine even in dirty water. However, due to its ragged, shabby appearance, it isn't popular.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Milotic
flavorText: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.
Attack1Text: Shuffle 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into their deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Regice
flavorText: It is said to have slept in a glacier for thousands of years. Its body can't be melted, even by magma.
Ability1Text: If you have Regirock in play, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Stage 2 Pokémon.

name: Shellos
flavorText: For the most part, it makes its home along the seashore. Its color and form differ according to its habitat and the quality of its food.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Alolan Raichu
flavorText: It only evolves to this form in the Alola region. According to researchers, its diet is one of the causes of this change.
Ability1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Alolan Geodude
flavorText: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Alolan Graveler
flavorText: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of part of its body.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

name: Alolan Golem-GX
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

name: Emolga
flavorText: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
Attack1Text: Put 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Lightning Pokémon.

name: Gastly
flavorText: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Haunter
flavorText: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

name: Gengar
flavorText: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.
Ability1Text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Mismagius
flavorText: It appears as if from nowhere—muttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand during their next turn.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

name: Spoink
flavorText: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

name: Grumpig
flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon can't be Confused.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Chimecho
flavorText: It uses the sucker on its head to hang from a tree or from eaves. It can produce seven different tones.
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon that has an Ability from their hand during their next turn.

name: Pumpkaboo
flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
Attack1Text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

name: Gourgeist
flavorText: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, you may discard any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Salandit
flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Salazzle
flavorText: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

name: Oranguru
flavorText: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.
Attack1Text: Put 3 Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Nihilego-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Mankey
flavorText: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Primeape
flavorText: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Cubone
flavorText: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Regirock
flavorText: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.
Ability1Text: Your Registeel's attacks do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Gastrodon
flavorText: It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if parts of it are bitten off by fish Pokémon, it will return to normal within a few hours.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Stufful
flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

name: Bewear
flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from the attacks of your opponent's non-Fire Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Buzzwole-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Houndour
flavorText: Around dawn, its ominous howl echoes through the area to announce that this is its territory.

name: Houndoom
flavorText: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Deino
flavorText: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Zweilous
flavorText: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

name: Hydreigon
flavorText: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 3 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, discard your other Benched Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Guzzlord-GX
Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

name: Guzzlord-GX
Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

name: Mawile
flavorText: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Aron
flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

name: Lairon
flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

name: Aggron
flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Registeel
flavorText: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.
Attack1Text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If Regice is on your Bench, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Escavalier
flavorText: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Kartana-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Attack2Text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you'll become sleepy right away.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Wigglytuff
flavorText: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If any of your opponent's Pokémon have any Darkness Energy attached to them, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Xerneas
flavorText: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't use Bright Horns during your next turn.

name: Alolan Exeggutor-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Jangmo-o
flavorText: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.

name: Hakamo-o
flavorText: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

name: Kommo-o
flavorText: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
Attack1Text: If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Miltank
flavorText: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank's.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, heal 90 damage from that Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Swablu
flavorText: For some reason, it likes to land on people's heads softly and act like it's a hat.

name: Altaria
flavorText: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you're in a dream.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Dragon Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Starly
flavorText: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

name: Staravia
flavorText: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

name: Staraptor
flavorText: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by the damage from this attack, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Regigigas
flavorText: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon can't attack unless Regirock, Regice, and Registeel are on your Bench.
Attack1Text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

name: Regigigas
flavorText: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon can't attack unless Regirock, Regice, and Registeel are on your Bench.
Attack1Text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

name: Minccino
flavorText: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cinccino
flavorText: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
Attack1Text: Choose 2 cards from your discard pile. Then, ask your opponent if you may put them into your hand. If yes, put those cards into your hand. If no, this attack does 80 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Bunnelby
flavorText: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

name: Diggersby
flavorText: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Type: Null
flavorText: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Silvally-GX
Ability1Text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Gyarados-GX
Attack2Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

name: Alolan Golem-GX
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Attack2Text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

Attack1Text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack2Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

Attack1Text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Attack2Text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
